summary: The "Closing the Meal Gap Act of 2025" aims to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008. Key provisions include calculating Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits based on a "low-cost food plan" (a diet for a 4-person family), adjusting benefits for inflation and location, adjusting the quality control system, modifying medical expense deductions, eliminating the time limit, and making conforming amendments throughout the act. The bill seeks to improve food security and potentially increase SNAP benefits for some recipients.
